biography.value: Yeti are hulking monstrosities that stalk alpine peaks in a ceaseless hunt for food. Their snow-white fur lets them move like ghosts against the frozen landscape.

description.value:
The yeti can use its Chilling Gaze and makes two claw attacks.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 1d6 + @mod type=slashing average=true]] damage plus [[/damage 1d6 type=cold average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

The yeti targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see the yeti, the target must succeed on a [[/save con 13 format=long]] against this magic or take [[/damage 3d6 type=cold average=true]] damage and then be &Reference[paralyzed]{paralyzed} for 1 minute, unless it is immune to &Reference[cold]{cold} damage. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the targetâ€™s saving throw is successful, or if the effect ends on it, the target is immune to the Chilling Gaze of all yetis (but not abominable yeti;abominable yetis) for 1 hour.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

Fear of &Reference[fire]{Fire}. If the yeti takes &Reference[fire]{fire} damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Keen Smell. The yeti has advantage on &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} (&Reference[prc]{Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Snow Camouflage. The yeti has advantage on &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} (&Reference[ste]{Stealth}) checks made to hide in snowy terrain.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].
